The value of lead time

16 Jun 2017

In two very nice papers, Suzanne and her collaborators developped an interesting idea about valuing lead time based on financial mathematics concepts used traditionally for option pricing. In the standard newsvendor model, the profits of the firm at delivery time for an order of units are

\[ \begin{align} \Pi_T &= p \min(D_T,Q) - c Q + s \max(Q-D_T, 0) \\ &= (p-c) Q - (p-s) \max(Q-D_T, 0), \end{align} \]

Looking closer at the profits, one recognizes in the payoff of a put option on the demand with strike . Under absence of arbitrage, the price of such an option is , where denotes the risk-neutral probability measure, and thus the expected profit can be written as

\[ E^{\mathcal{Q}}_t \left[ \Pi_T \right] = (p-c) Q - (p-s) P(D_t,t,T,Q). \]
